summary:
Metformin is a widely used medicine to treat type 2 diabetes, especially for overweight people. It helps lower blood sugar levels and is also used for polycystic ovary syndrome. This drug is often prescribed along with antipsychotics to reduce the risk of metabolic syndrome.

Common side effects include stomach issues like diarrhea and nausea. It's generally safe but can cause low blood sugar and high lactic acid levels if not used correctly. Metformin was first discovered in the 1920s and has been a crucial diabetes treatment since the 1950s. It's now one of the most prescribed medications worldwide.
title: Metformin
